reviews.text:
Famous station in London. Well-connected by trains, underground lines and buses.
Very nice historical architecture marries well with the modern shops and cafes. Free toilets are available on the ground floor.
One cannot skip the Paddington Bear shop. You may have to queue – many are taking pictures with famous bear.

This a big historical station in the heart of London.It is connected with trains , tube underground station and buses.

It's well connect d thought all London.
Also there is an Express train from Heathrow airport to Paddington station which take around 15-17 minutes.
The staff is Friendly and helpful.
The station contains a lot of shops , fast food restaurant , bakery and coffee to go.
Also there is a famous bar in the upper floor .

Many platforms but still easy to get about despite being a very busy station. Lots of choices to get a snack. Toilets are near to platform 1.  Allow a few minutes to be already on the platform as trains depart swiftly and there are many passengers with large cases.
Lovely station, very friendly staff. Nice shops around. Clean. Only five minute walk to famous Hyde Park.

Considering the amount of people travelling and the number of trains, this is a great station. 

Only 4 stars for 2 reasons:
1) They could do with more sitting area
2) The mobile network is often congested in the area resulting in no internet. (arguably that depends on individual networks I assume but could do with an upgrade)
